title: Maitua Feterika
text:
Maitua Feterika (born 19 May 1992) is a New Zealand <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played for the <a href="Brisbane%20Broncos">Brisbane Broncos</a> and <a href="St%20George%20Illawarra%20Dragons">St George Illawarra Dragons</a> in the <a href="NRL%20Women%27s%20Premiership">NRL Women's Premiership</a>.
Primarily a er, she has represented <a href="Samoa%20women%27s%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Samoa</a>, <a href="Kiwi%20Ferns">New Zealand</a> and <a href="Queensland%20women%27s%20rugby%20league%20team">Queensland</a>.
Playing career.
A <a href="Otahuhu%20Leopards">Otahuhu Leopards</a> junior, Feterika represented <a href="Samoa%20women%27s%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Samoa</a> in their Test match against <a href="Australian%20Jillaroos">Australia</a> in 2011.
In 2014, while playing for <a href="Counties%20Manukau%20rugby%20league%20team">Counties Manukau</a>, she was selected for <a href="Kiwi%20Ferns">New Zealand</a>, starting on the wing in their 12–8 win over Australia at <a href="WIN%20Stadium">WIN Stadium</a>. On 2 December 2017, she started at in New Zealand's <a href="2017%20Women%27s%20Rugby%20League%20World%20Cup%20Final">2017 Women's Rugby League World Cup Final</a> loss to Australia.
2018.
In 2018, Feterika moved to Australia, joining <a href="Ipswich%20Brothers">Ipswich Brothers</a> in the <a href="Queensland%20Rugby%20League">QRL</a> Women's Division 1 competition. In June, she represented South East Queensland at the Women's National Championships. On 22 June, Feterika represented <a href="Queensland%20women%27s%20rugby%20league%20team">Queensland</a> under residency rules. 
On 28 June, she signed with the <a href="Brisbane%20Broncos">Brisbane Broncos</a> <a href="NRL%20Women%27s%20Premiership">NRL Women's Premiership</a> team. In Round 1 of the <a href="2018%20NRL%20Women%27s%20season">2018 NRL Women's season</a>, Feterika made her debut in the Broncos' 30–4 win over the <a href="St%20George%20Illawarra%20Dragons">St George Illawarra Dragons</a>, scoring a try. On 30 September, she started at in the Broncos' 34–12 <a href="2018%20NRL%20Grand%20Final">Grand Final</a> win over the <a href="Sydney%20Roosters">Sydney Roosters</a>.
2019.
In April, revised eligibility laws were announced by the QRL, which ruled Feterika ineligible to represent Queensland. In May, she represented South East Queensland at the Women's National Championships. 
In June, Feterika joined <a href="St%20Marys%20Saints">St Marys RLFC</a> in the <a href="NSWRL%20Women%27s%20Premiership">NSWRL Women's Premiership</a>. In July, she signed with the <a href="St%20George%20Illawarra%20Dragons">St George Illawarra Dragons</a>. On 6 October, she started at prop in the Dragons' 6–30 <a href="2019%20NRL%20Grand%20Final">Grand Final</a> loss to the Broncos.
2020.
In 2020, Feterika began the season playing fore St Marys before returning to New Zealand due to the <a href="COVID-19%20pandemic">COVID-19 pandemic</a>, which saw her miss the <a href="2020%20NRL%20Women%27s%20season">2020 NRL Women's season</a>. On 7 November, she played her 10th Test for New Zealand in a 28–8 win over Samoa.
